channel.title: Character Saving
channel.description: So I just downloaded the Complexity V1 source, and I'm having a slight problem fixing characters saving. It doesn't save any characters that log in so any progress made is pointless. I looked for the login, logout, and saving methods and wasn't really sure as to where to start. Can anyone help me or give me advice?

item.title: Character Saving
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

Camballer:

@IfearI thank you so much for that find, I played with it a little bit and made a folder on my desktop named “characters” and it saves them there now, not a huge deal. Thanks again for the help!

Glad it helped.

If you want, just change the path in the code so it goes to a more desired path.
Most of the time people use something like “./Data/characters/”

Read full topic

item.title: Character Saving
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

Camballer:

It’s the normal Source/Data/Characters path, so yeah theres a place for the characters to be saved, it just won’t save them, it doesn’t even register them when you log in. There’s also a playersave.java file but I couldn’t figure out what was wrong with it.

			String desktop = System.getProperty("user.home") + "/Desktop";
			characterfile = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(""+desktop+"/characters/"+p.playerName+".txt"));

It doesn’t save it under source/data/characters tho? More like under your desktop in a characters file?

Edit:
Shouldn’t be a problem though*

Also, I’m assuming those - //System.out.println(“first”); - messages didn’t print out when you uncommented them?

Read full topic

That didn’t do anything
